author: bridge-bot
content:
<KamilChNethermind> re: **@chfast**
> @KamilChNethermind Can we actually switch performance-modexp to fusaka instead of maintaining this separate config?
Not yet at the moment - but will be working on that. Will talk with EEST team to allow Benchmarks to be written with Fusaka fork

author: bridge-bot
content:
<siladu> Just catching up on ACDT. Not sure where the EcRecover issue that was mentioned is coming from so I'll follow up on that.
Using opcode benchmarking dashboard, our production release has EcRecover at ~45MGps so should support 135MGas blocks within 3 second window...furthermore we have an improvement on the performance branch (pushed to on August 11th) that brings EcRecover to ~52MGps so 156MGas blocks. Can see before and after here:
https://grafana.observability.ethpandaops.io/d/feo4ronhsqv40d/opcodes-benchmarking?orgId=1&from=now-30d&to=now&timezone=browser&var-posgreSQL=benuragv7iuwwb&var-ClientName=besu&var-TestTitle=EcRecover%20precompile&var-TestTitle=EcRecoverCACHABLE&var-TestTitle=EcRecoverUNCACHABLE&var-TestTitle=EcRecoverUNCACHABLE2&viewPanel=panel-23

Besu team is currently looking at the newly discovered EEST opcode benchmark issues to unblock 60M.

Before those came up I think we were good for 60M and were looking at unblocking 60MGas+ by improving EcAdd, for which we have some improvements that need productionising, but is now less urgent than the opcodes.

We are also looking at general improvements that should impact opcodes/evm performance overall.

cc @vdWijden @KamilChNethermind

author: siladu
content: cc <@827653956955406406> - couldn't find you in TG
